Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meetings of June 13 and June 20, 2006 be adopted and printed by Council Member Recchia.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Rivera moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of June 13, 2006 and the Recessed Meeting held on June 20, 2006 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-225(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an enclosed sidewalk café located at 627 9th Avenue, Community Board #4, shall be subject to review by the Council. (Application no. 20065538 TCM.)
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe, Rudy’s Bar & Grill, Manhattan (20065538TCM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Gerson:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 324 Bowery, Community Board 2, Application 20065502 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe, 324 Bowery, Manhattan (20065502TCM)

Items.Title: Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees
Report of the Committee on Consumer Affairs

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring credit counseling agencies to notify consumers when they are not approved pursuant to the Bankruptcy Prevention and Consumer Protection Act of 2005.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Bankruptcy Prevention and Consumer Protection Act of 2005.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Environmental Protection
A Local Law in relation to the temporary task force to study the feasibility of transferring city-owned wetlands to the jurisdiction of the department of parks and recreation.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Temporary task force to study the feasibility of transferring city-owned wetlands to the jurisdiction of the department of parks and recreation.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Finance

Resolution concerning the extension of the Village Alliance Business Improvement District in the Borough of Manhattan and setting the date, time and place for the public hearing to hear all persons interested in the extension of such district.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Extension of the Village Alliance BID, Manhattan

Items.Title: Resolution to amend Res. No. 304 for 2006 which approved a new partial tax exemption from real property taxes for a property located at 2177 Frederick Douglas Boulevard, (Block 1944, Lot 36), Manhattan, pursuant to Section 577 of the Private Housing Finance Law (Preconsidered L.U. Items.MinutesNote:
At this point, the Speaker (Council Member Quinn) asked for a Moment of Silence in memory of the following individuals:

Staff Sgt. Eric Caban, 28, of N.Y., N.Y., died on July 19, 2006 in southern Afghanistan of injuries sustained when his combat reconnaissance patrol came in contact with enemy contact with enemy forces using small arms fire during combat operations on July 18.
Sgt. Caban was assigned to the 3rd Bttalion, 7th Special Forces Group (Airborne), Fort Bragg, North Carolina.

Marine Cpl. Julian A. Ramon, 22, of Flusing, N.Y., died on July 20, 2006 while conducting combat operations in Iraq's Anbar province.  He was assigned to the 3rd Battalion, 8th Marine Regiment, 2nd Marine Division, 2nd Marine Expeditionary Force, at Camp Lejeune, North Carolina.

Spc. Hai Ming Hsia, 37, of N.Y., N.Y., died on August 1, 2006 during combat operations in Ar Ramadi, Iraq.  Spc. Hsia was assigned to the 6th Infrantry Regiment, 1st Armored Division, Baumholder, Germany.

At a later point in the Meeting, the Speaker (Council Member Quinn) also asked for a Moment of Silence in memory of NYPD officer Eric Concepcion, 29, of the Bronx, who was killed while off-duty on the West Side Highway on August 14, 2006 after being struck and dragged on his motorcycle by a drunken motorist.   He was a six-year veteran  and leaves behind a wife and two young daughters.
